problem_text:
A group action on a compact space is said to be topologically free if the set of points with trivial stabilizer is dense. Let G be a locally compact group, and ∂spG its Furstenberg boundary (the largest minimal and strongly proximal compact G-space). Let Γ1 and Γ2 be two lattices in G, both acting faithfully on ∂spG.
a) Is it possible that the Γ1-action on ∂spG is topologically free, but the Γ2-action on ∂spG is not topologically free?
b) If yes, can this also happen if ∂spG = G/H is a homogeneous G-space?
A. Le Boudec
